title: Is the 'Star of Bethlehem' really a planet? A bright visitor this month may hold a clue.
summary: A brilliant point of light is rising in the eastern sky soon after dark this month, drawing comparisons to the "Star of Bethlehem."

title: تحت الدف
summary: انتهت المهمة بنجاح بالبيضاء، وتحول “جيش المستخدمين” بألوان حزبية، الملتحقين بشركات للتنمية المحلية، وشركتي النظافة وجمع الأزبال، إلى ذراع عسكري لرؤساء مقاطعات ومنتخبين، يدافعون عنهم بشراسة في أوقات الشدة. وبدأت العلمية، منذ سنوات، حين “اهتدى” رؤساء مقاطعات إلى أهمية “زرع” مجموعة من الشباب العاطلين …
body: انتهت المهمة بنجاح بالبيضاء، وتحول “جيش المستخدمين” بألوان حزبية، الملتحقين بشركات للتنمية المحلية، وشركتي النظافة وجمع الأزبال، إلى ذراع عسكري لرؤساء مقاطعات ومنتخبين، يدافعون عنهم بشراسة في أوقات الشدة. وبدأت العلمية، منذ سنوات، حين “اهتدى” رؤساء مقاطعات إلى أهمية “زرع” مجموعة من الشباب العاطلين في دواليب شركتي أكمل القراءة » المقالة تحت الدف fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: 25 متهما في ملف “فوريان وجدة”
summary: ارتفع عدد الموقوفين على خلفية تفكيك شبكة لسرقة مركبات ودراجات نارية من المحجز البلدي بوجدة، إلى 25 متهما آخرهم اثنان أحيلا على الوكيل العام باستئنافية فاس بعد اعتقالهما، أخيرا، لوجودهما موضوع مذكرتي بحث وطنية أحدهما متهم بتفكيك السيارات المسروقة، والثاني سائق سيارة جر استعملت في نقل مركبات.أكمل الق…
body: ارتفع عدد الموقوفين على خلفية تفكيك شبكة لسرقة مركبات ودراجات نارية من المحجز البلدي بوجدة، إلى 25 متهما آخرهم اثنان أحيلا على الوكيل العام باستئنافية فاس بعد اعتقالهما، أخيرا، لوجودهما موضوع مذكرتي بحث وطنية أحدهما متهم بتفكيك السيارات المسروقة، والثاني سائق سيارة جر استعملت في نقل مركبات. أكمل القراءة » المقالة 25 متهما في ملف “فوريان وجدة” fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

summary:

body: Nature, Published online: 09 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03970-0 A global drop in public and private investment in agricultural science in the past four decades is partly to blame for high food prices, an analysis reveals.

title: بعد 3 أيام من اختفائه.. إنقاذ طفل سوري دفن حيا في تركيا
summary: أفادت وسائل إعلام تركية بعثور فرق البحث والإنقاذ في ولاية هاتاي على طفل سوري بعد اختفائه يوم الجمعة الماضية، حيث ضربه خاله على رأسه بحجر، وقام بدفنه.

title: Historic search for 'huge missing piece' of the universe turns up negative — but reveals new secrets of particle physics
summary: Scientists hunted dark matter and solar neutrinos with one of the largest experiments yet. While the neutrinos likely appeared, dark matter results couldn't be confirmed.

title: Ash Pendant: The only known depiction of a pregnant Viking woman
summary: The Ash Pendant was discovered in a Viking Age burial mound in Sweden and may have been used by a female shaman.

title: زلزال بقوة 6.36 درجة يضرب اليونان ويصل تركيا وإيطاليا
summary: قال المركز الألماني لأبحاث علوم الأرض (جي.إف.زد) اليوم السبت إن زلزالا بقوة 6.36 درجة ضرب اليونان.

title: Lost Indigenous settlements described by Jamestown colonist John Smith finally found
summary: Excavations along the Rappahannock River in Virginia have revealed the likely spot of Indigenous villages once described by John Smith.

title: Ethereal structure in the sky rivals 'Pillars of Creation' — Space photo of the week
summary: The twin telescopes of the Gemini Observatory mark 25 years of discovery as students name distant nebula Ua ʻŌhiʻa Lan.

title: What was the loudest sound ever recorded?
summary: Determining the "loudest recorded sound" depends on how you define sound and on which measurements you choose to include.

title: New NASA, ESA images show 3I/ATLAS getting active ahead of its close encounter with Earth
summary: NASA and ESA both shared new images of the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS this week, as the agencies gear up for the mysterious object's closest approach to Earth on Dec. 19.

title: Unusual, 1,400-year-old cube-shaped human skull unearthed in Mexico
summary: Archaeologists discovered an unusually flat-topped skull at a pre-Hispanic Mesoamerican site.

title: 1,800-year-old 'piggy banks' full of Roman-era coins unearthed in French village
summary: An excavation in a small French village reveals three jars with thousands of Roman coins.

title: What if Antony and Cleopatra had defeated Octavian?
summary: How would history have unfolded if Antony and Cleopatra had defeated Octavian? Would they have ruled the Roman Empire?

title: Giant sunspot on par with the one that birthed the Carrington Event has appeared on the sun — and it's pointed right at Earth
summary: A massive new sunspot complex, dubbed AR 4294-4296, has emerged on the sun and is facing directly at Earth. The dark patch is on par with the infamous sunspot that birthed the 1859 Carrington Event — but, for now, it's staying quiet.

title: A huge helium shortage is looming — but ancient rocks in Earth's crust may be hiding massive reservoirs
summary: For decades, helium has been produced with natural gas, generating huge carbon emissions. Now, geologists are looking for new helium sources — and finding enormous "carbon-free" reservoirs that could revolutionize the industry.

summary:
Nature, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03937-1

A panel of US vaccine advisers voted to rescind a recommendation that all newborns should receive a hepatitis B vaccine at birth.
body: Nature, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03937-1 A panel of US vaccine advisers voted to rescind a recommendation that all newborns should receive a hepatitis B vaccine at birth.

title: Male human heads found in a 'skull pit' in an ancient Chinese city hint at sex-specific sacrifice rituals
summary: A genetic study of 80 skulls found at a Stone Age city in China has revealed that the sacrificed people were mostly men, in contrast to previous assumptions.

title: Volcanic eruption triggered 'butterfly effect' that led to the Black Death, researchers find
summary: A volcanic eruption in 1345 may have kicked off a series of events that led to the Black Death sweeping through medieval Europe.

title: 18,000 dinosaur tracks discovered along ancient Bolivian coastline — and they set a new record
summary: Researchers have counted 16,600 fossilized dinosaur footprints and 1,378 swim tracks at a site in Bolivia that showcase a variety of behaviors and different theropods from the Cretaceous period.

title: Collapse of key Atlantic current could bring extreme drought to Europe for hundreds of years, study finds
summary: Scientists modeled Europe's future if a key Atlantic current were to collapse and found that the continent faces a much drier future.

title: Giant rotating string of galaxies is 'probably the largest spinning object' in the known universe
summary: A giant rotating filament of the cosmic web may be the largest spinning structure ever seen, and could help reveal how galaxies form.

title: Ancient 'hanging coffin' people in China finally identified — and their descendants still live there today
summary: People buried in "hanging coffins" thousands of years ago in China and Southeast Asia have finally been identified through DNA research.

title: 'An extreme end of human genetic variation': Ancient humans were isolated in southern Africa for nearly 100,000 years, and their genetics are stunningly different
summary: Ancient genomes from southern Africa show that people evolved in isolation for upward of 100,000 years.

title: China has planted so many trees it's changed the entire country's water distribution
summary: Huge "regreening" efforts in China over the past few decades have activated the country's water cycle and moved water in ways that scientists are just now starting to understand.

title: James Webb telescope spots strange 'super-puff' planet frantically chasing its own atmosphere through space
summary: New James Webb telescope observations of the 'super-puff' planet WASP-107b show that the exoplanet's runaway atmosphere is frantically escaping into space.

summary:

body: Nature, Published online: 03 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09759-5 Rapidly growing satellite constellations pose a substantial threat to astronomical observations, with projections indicating that future space telescopes will have more than 96% of their exposures affected by satellite trails, necessitating urgent mitigation strategies.

title: 'Cold Supermoon' 2025: It's not too late to see the last, highest full moon of the year
summary: The Cold Moon, the 12th and final full moon of 2025, rose on Thursday (Dec. 4) but will still appear bright and full on Friday (Dec. 5)

title: صور وفيديو.. هيكل "ريشات" المذهل في صحراء موريتانيا
summary: هيكل جيولوجي مذهل عمره لا يقل عن 100 مليون عام.. أشبه بعين حمراء أو عين ثور يمكن رؤيته من الفضاء.

title: Trio of 'black mesas' leftover from Paleozoic era spawn rare sand dunes in the Sahara — Earth from space
summary: A 2023 astronaut photo shows three dark hills, or mesas, towering above part of the Sahara desert in southern Mauritania. The structures are remnants of a single Paleozoic era formation, and have helped to create a series of striking sand dunes.

title: An extra solar system planet once orbited next to Earth — and it may be the reason we have a moon
summary: Earth may have a moon today because a nearby neighbor once crashed into us, a new analysis of Apollo samples and terrestrial rocks reveals.

title: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is erupting in 'ice volcanoes', new images suggest
summary: Scientists have observed cryovolcanoes erupting on comet 3I/ATLAS — giving us a new clue about what's inside it.

title: ماذا قال توم كروز عند تسلمة أول أوسكار في مسيرته الفنية؟
summary: أشاد النجم الأميركي توم كروز بتأثير السينما وقدرتها على تغيير حياة الناس، وذلك خلال تسلمه جائزة أوسكار فخرية في حفل نظمته أكاديمية فنون وعلوم الصور المتحركة في لوس أنجلوس، حيث احتفت هوليوود بمسيرته الممتدة لأكثر من 45 عاماً وبإسهاماته في صناعة السينما.
